q: effort to speed up the decision-making within the company. Eric Schmidt has also drafted a plan to sell some of the stock he holds in the company. The news surfaced in a regulatory filing last week. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. Eric Schmidt holds 9.2 million shares of Google stock and has 9.6% of the company's voting power according to Reuters. He plans to sell 534,000 shares of Class A common stock--

He said Wall Street was comfortable with Eric Schmidt , and that investors may question whether Larry Page is the right person for the job because he lacks CEO experience at a major public company.
